item.description:
Directions to the Ranger Station (then continue on to the dog-friendly parking lot):

From Points North: I-95/Rt. 128 South, take Exit 17, Rt. 135 West. Turn left onto South St. After 1.1 mi. turn left onto ?Chestnut St. Continue onto Dedham St. for 2 mi. to Caryl Park parking (40 cars) on left.

 From Points South: I-95/Rt. 128 North, take Exit 16B, Rt. 109 West. Turn right at Grove St. Continue onto Country Club Rd., then Westfield St. Left at Dedham St. for 2 mi. to Caryl Park parking (40 cars) on left.

 Feel free to stop at the ranger station to see if there are any maps (I am planning on printing mine out beforehand), but then get back in your car and continue on Dedham St. and park next to the playing fields on the left.

As we get closer we will be better able to predict trail conditions.  I'm planning on hiking for around 2 hours, not too speedy but a nice pace.  I will give out my cell phone before the 19th so people can get in touch with me if they are running late or lost.
item.how_to_find_us: I drive a red SUV and have a big, brown curly haired dog!
item.why: Noanet Woodlands is in Dover and dogs are allowed off leash. There are more than 17 miles of trails with a view of the Boston skyline from Noanet Peak.
item.name: Explore Noanet Woodlands
